text: Math 257/316 Homework 7 Question 1 (submit) The aim of this exercise is to solve the following non-homogeneous heat equation: ut = kuxx + F (x, t) for 0 < x < L, t > 0 u(0, t) = 0 and u(L, t) = 0 for t > 0 u(x, 0) = f (x) for 0 ≤ x ≤ L, (1) where F (x, t) represents a source of heat energy in the medium. In the case F ≡ 0 we know that a solution is of the form ∞∑ n=1 bn sin ( nπx L ) e −n2π2kt/L2, in which the bn are the coeﬃcients in the Fourier sine expansion of f on [0, L]. For the non-homogeneous problem, we will take a cue from that case and attempt a solution u(x, t) = ∞∑ n=1 Tn(t) sin ( nπx L ) . (2) The problem is to determine each Tn(t). 1. By observing that, for a given t, equation (2) can be interpreted as the Fourier sine expansion of u(x, t), considered as a function of x, with Tn(t) being the nth Fourier coeﬃcient in this expansion, carefully establish the expression for Tn(t). 2. Now assume that for each t ≥ 0, F (x, t), as a function of x, can also be expanded in a Fourier sine series: F (x, t) = ∞∑ n=1 Bn(t) sin (nπx L ) dx (3) where Bn(t) = 2 L ∫ L 0 F (ξ, t) sin ( nπξ L ) dξ (4) is the coeﬃcient in this expansion, and may depend on t. Determine and solve the diﬀerential equation satisﬁed by Tn(t) for all n = 1, 2, . . . 3. Deduce the solution of (1).
